wiki.content: Matt wrote the song with the Olympics in mind. It's about total conviction and pure determination to win. According to the Survival Songfacts, Matt Bellamy told BBC Radio 1 DJ Zane Lowe that he had been approached to write a song about the Olympics in 2011, but the project "went away." "Then when we were asked to play the ending ceremony," he continued, "the song had developed so we got the Olympic people in to hear it and they said they'd love to use it as the official tune." User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License and may also be available under the GNU FDL.
wiki.summary: Matt wrote the song with the Olympics in mind. It's about total conviction and pure determination to win. According to the Survival Songfacts, Matt Bellamy told BBC Radio 1 DJ Zane Lowe that he had been approached to write a song about the Olympics in 2011, but the project "went away." "Then when we were asked to play the ending ceremony," he continued, "the song had developed so we got the Olympic people in to hear it and they said they'd love to use it as the official tune."

track.name: Survival
comments: No, you're not going to win.

With prelude this song makes mediocre
(С прелюдией эта песня становится посредственной)
Horrible? What the actual FUCK. This is an absolute legendary epic of a song. How can you not like the insane wailing and devastating bellerz riff-fest? It is pure magic.
I want to ride my bike (to this) fast!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Intro reminds me of Electric Light Orchestra; Great song!

Listened to this song after playing the new 'Tomb Raider' game.
I kept seeing a trailer highlighting what had happened to Lara during that game in my head.
Q Innuendo. similar riff, but faster here

This song is the brief moment of this album that made me feel I was listening to a new Muse album back in 2003. The old intense Apocalypse Please chanting coupled with an addicting and itch-scratching solo elevation. 
Bellamy stepped out of his new boring persona and rocked out on this one, loved it.
this one is a real motivator !
Not a big fan of the first half of the song, especially the lyrics and choir. But fuck, that outro is truly one of the pinnacle moments of their entire discography.
